title: Benedict Cumberbatch wraps up warm as fans gather outside NY studio
text:
Benedict wrapped up warm to leave the building and get into the warmth of his waiting car (Picture: Backgrid)

Benedict Cumberbatch was understandably in the mood to get straight into a heated car on Tuesday as he bypassed waiting fans who were huddled in the brisk October weather for a sighting of the Sherlock star.

Benedict was in New York for an appearance on the Build Series.

But as he wrapped up warm, he was quick to leave the building and get into the warmth of his waiting car.

The Avengers star was in town with his co-star Tuppence Middleton to promote their film The Current War.

They were joined by Michael Shannon and the movie’s director Alfonso Gomez-Rejon.

Benedict Cumberbatch (Picture: Backgrid)

Benedict Cumberbatch (Picture: Backgrid)

His appearance came the day after the stars all walked the red carpet at the New York premiere for the film.

It follows the corporate battle between George Westinghouse, Nikola Tesla and Thomas Edison which would decide whose electrical system would be the one to illuminate the world.

Benedict Cumberbatch (Picture: Backgrid)

The 2017 film was a casualty of the Weinstein scandal, left in something like limbo after the movie mogul was ousted and hit UK cinemas earlier in 2019.

It received a new distributor and director Gomez-Rejon got a second shot at editing the film, adding five scenes while at the same time cutting the movie down to ten minutes shorter than the version which premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2017.

Yet Metro.co.uk gave it just two and a half stars, suggesting the film ‘strives for humour, poignancy, suspense and wonder’.

‘Yet, in trying to squeeze the stories of three of history’s most important innovators into one hour and 47 minutes – including, for no discernible reason, flashbacks to Westinghouse’s time in the Civil War – it feels rushed’.
description: Benedict Cumberbatch was in New York to promote The Current War.
